1 January 2012 A New Species of Thismia (Thismiaceae) from West Kalimantan, Borneo
Hirokazu Tsukaya, Hiroshi Okada
Author Affiliations +
Hirokazu Tsukaya,1 Hiroshi Okada2,3

1Department of Biological Sciences, Faculty of Science, The University of Tokyo, 7-3-1 Hongo, Bunkyo-ku, Tokyo 113-0033, Japan.
2Graduate School of Science, Osaka City University, Sugimoto, Sumiyoshi-ku, Osaka 558-8585, Japan.
3Institute of Natural Environmental Sciences, University of Hyogu, Sanda, Hyogo 669-1546, Japan.
Systematic Botany, 37(1):53-57 (2012). https://doi.org/10.1600/036364412X616639

LITERATURE CITED

  • O. Beccari 1877. Geomitra clavigera Becc. Malesia 1: 251, Tav. X, f. 1. Google Scholar

  • S. Chantanaorrapint 2008. Thismia angustimitra (Thismiaceae), a new species from Thailand. Blumea 53: 524–526. Google Scholar

  • S. Chantanaorrapint and A. Chantanaorrapint. 2009. Thismia clavigera (Thismiaceae), a new record for Thailand. Thai Forest Bulletin (Botany) 37: 27–31. Google Scholar

  • G. W. C. Ho, S. S. Mar, and R. M. Saunders. 2009. Thismia tentaticulata (Burmanniaceae tribe Thismieae) from Hong Kong: first record of the genus and tribe from continental China. Journal of Systematics and Evolution 47: 605–607. Google Scholar

  • J. E. Jarvie 1996. Thismia lauriana (Burmanniaceae), a new species from Central Kalimantan. Blumea 41: 257–259. Google Scholar

  • F. P. Jonker 1948. Burmanniaceae. Pp. 14–26 in Flora Malesiana. I, 4., ed. C. G. G. J. van Steenis. Jakarta and Leiden: Noordhoff. Google Scholar

  • K. Larsen and L. V. Averyanov. 2007. Thismia annamensis and T. tentaculata, two new species of the family Thismiaceae from central Vietnam. VNU Journal of Science. Natural Sciences and Technology 23: 245–252. Google Scholar

  • H. Maas-van de Kamer 1998. Burmanniaceae. Pp. 154–164 in Families and genera of vascular plants. Monocotyledons. Lilianae (except Orchidaceae), ed. K. Kubitzki. Berlin: Springer. Google Scholar

  • V. Merckx 2008. Myco-heterotrophy in Dioscoreales. Systematics and evolution. Ph. D. thesis. Belgium: University of Leuven. Google Scholar

  • H. Okada and H. Tsukaya. 2010. A new species of Pipthospatha (Araceae: Schismatoglottideae) from West Kalimantan, Indonesia Borneo. Acta Phytotaxonomica et Geobotanica 61: 87–92. Google Scholar

  • H. N. Ridley 1924. Thismia. Pp. 307–308 in The flora of the Malay Peninsula. Vol. 4., London: L. Reeve and Co. Google Scholar

  • R. M. K. Saunders 1996. Typification of the name Thismia fumia Ridl. (Burmanniaceae). Taxon 45: 107–109. Google Scholar

  • B. C. Stone 1980. Rediscovery of Thismia clavigera (Becc.) F. v. M. (Burmanniaceae). Blumea 26: 419–425. Google Scholar

  • B. C. Stone and M. Ratnasabapathy. 1980. Thismia clavigera (Burmanniaceae), a saprophyte new to the Malayan flora, and notes on other Thismia species in the peninsula. Sains Malaysiana 9: 209–214. Google Scholar

  • H. Tsukaya, M. Nakajima, and H. Okada. 2011. Kalimantanorchis: a new genus of mycotrophic orchid from West Kalimantan, Borneo. Systematic Botany 36: 49–52. Google Scholar

  • H. Tsukaya and H. Okada. 2005. Thismia mullerensis (Burmanniaceae), a new species from Muller Range, Central Kalimantan. Acta Phytotaxonomica et Geobotanica 56: 129–133. Google Scholar

  • C. G. G. J. Van Steenis 1982. Thismia clavigera. Pp. 554–555 in Flora Malesiana. I, 9 ed. C. G. G. J. van Steenis. Jakarta and Leiden: Noordhoff. Google Scholar

  • J. Vermeulen and H. Tsukaya. 2011. An assumedly rheophytic orchid: Bulbophyllum rheophyton n. sp., from Borneo. Plant Systematics and Evolution 293: 71–73. Google Scholar

  • S.-Z. Yang, R. M. K. Saunders, and C.-J. Hsu. 2002. Thismia taiwanensis sp. nov. (Burmanniaceae tribe Thismieae): first record of the tribe in China. Systematic Botany 273: 485–488. Google Scholar
